comment.author: 44274283@N07
comment._content: One leg shorter than the other?

comment.author: 20727502@N00
comment._content:
Resisting the urge to tag cars (as we are wont to do), but I think there's a VW hatchback (maybe a Jetta or Passat), a Renault 5, and a Micra (or maybe a Fiesta). I can't see the OPW allowing anyone (staff or visitor) to park their hatchbacks out front like that any more.

More interesting though is the restoration work on the parapet top right. And the trees. Comparing to the 19th century photo they seem to be the same trees and shrubs. And I suppose why wouldn't they be - after 100 years of care and topiary.

comment.author: 37876430@N06
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/44274283@N07] 

100 years ago the photographer would have had his camera mounted on a tripod complete with spirit level.  He would also have a a "rising front" on his camera to avoid the dreaded "converging verticals" we see here.  Progress eh??  Bob
